data.title: Great venue, great food, needs better wine
data.text: Very fun venue downtown if you are looking for something different, the kind of place people dont think exists in SLC, a very nice surprise. Food is great, not enormous amount of choice, but all done very well, which is the best balance in my mind. Only thing that really needs changing is the wine selection, dont mind not having many choices but need to be something good. The "good" red wine really was awful.

data.title: Unexpected Surprise
data.text: Went here for a GNO - one of my companions joked that the atmosphere of the restaurant made it probably the most romantic GNO that I think we've ever had. Got a lot of small plates and split several dishes, all of which were great. We got both the roast chicken and gnocchi, which were both awesome, and the beignets for dessert. As the only drinker in the group, we also found out that they did mocktails, which was a great option for us.

data.title: I died and went to beignet!
data.text: I'm someone who never peeked into a  wrapped up package, and that's what Bodega is like. Let's keep the fun of the surprise. Trust me. You will enjoy unwrapping this present. And remember the better gifts come in small sizes!

data.title: Dinner w buddies
data.text: Enjoyed the experience of going downstairs and seeing a cozy, wood bar, books, candles, and a variety of dimly lit and different tables. It's the vibe, the atmosphere that makes this place fun. Honestly the food was fine, not great. We tried chicken, braised rind and scallop after a few apps. Great beer on tap.

data.title: Best Food in Park City!
data.text: We were here for a week long ski trip and have been visiting Park City for the past 30 years. Went to three of the top 10 Trip Advisor restaurants before visiting Bodega. Wow, blew everything else awa! Even met the owner Paola Bella and her husband who was cooking all kinds of stuff. Ok, the FARM bartender had said the HANDLE was his first choice in PC. Well, HANDLE was a big second to this place! We had the octopus salad, paquilla stuffed peppers, and the lamb lollipops. Oh my...none done better! Best experience we've had in years. We will be back!

data.title: The Rest has a new chef but it is the same cool
data.text: The less you know before you go the better. The mystique is half the experience. If you haven't been here and are looking for a unique experience just make a reservation through OpenTable and find out what happens. If you are already familiar with it you should know the menu has changed. I would describe it as more upscale with higher quality but smaller quantity plates.

data.title: (D)inner sanctum
data.text:
We met at Bodega for dinner at its downstairs not advertised dining area, The Rest. You are greeted at the back of a small upstairs bar and escorted down by a hostess into a locked area. A long thin dining area is flanked at one side with a bar . The bartender spends part of his time spinning old vinyl records as your background music. There is an imaginative list of cocktails and beers. The bartender will even make up a custom cocktail for you if you highlight what are two ingredients that you have previously enjoyed. The menu was small but every item we tasted was exceptional. The presentation on the scallops was beautiful. Housemade charcuterie. You would go terribly wrong if you had not saved room for the beignet to finish. Service was a bit slow but this was a relaxed evening out.
I would also like to go back another time and try to muscle my way into the tight sitting upstairs into the Bodega area for $2 Tuesday. $2 for tacos, tequila, Tecate. Patrons upstairs were playing Jenga and board games and enjoying tacos.
Downstairs the generous small plate entrees ranged in price between 11 and $25, cocktails were 9 to $13.
I would go back to this restaurant with pleasure

user_location.name: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States

data.title: Unexpected on Main Street
data.text:
You would never know that this place exists from the street, Don't be dissuaded by the street level entry - once you are greeted and have a reservation, you are escorted through a locked door, down a corridor and stairs to a charming subterranean chamber.
We sat at the bar and had cocktails and dinner.
Excellent food and service, great atmosphere, not inexpensive but worth it. One of the better restaurants that I have tried in Salt Lake City and certainly memorable!
